description: REQUIREMENTParks Canada requires a contractor for construction of an in-situ containment wall to prevent the migration of heating fuel spilled beneath a historical building in Dawson City Historic Complex National Historical Site from migrating offsite onto neighbouring properties and roadways. Contractor must perform and complete the Work no later than April 30, 2023.  \\_TWO STAGE SELECTION PROCESS\\\\This posting is the Stage Two of a two-stage solicitation process: the first stage was to evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers. The second stage (Stage Two) is to invite the qualified suppliers to provide further qualifications and a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. \\_Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.
duration_in_months: For manufacture and/or procurement of a performance evaluation of systems, structures, facilities, products, services and work on the contrary rendered for CP.

**Tender Closing Date:** March 19, 2024, at 4:00 PM
**Expected Contract Start Date:** April 22, 2024
**Expected Contract End Date:** April 30, 2024

**Prequalification Requirements**
-------------------------------

Parks Canada seeks a qualified contractor to design, build, and instal an in-situ containment wall to mitigate the spread of a heating fuel spill affecting the Dawson National Historic Site in the Yukon Territory.

**Notice Classification**
-------------------------

This is the second stage of a two-stage solicitation process where prequalified bidders will be invited to submit further qualifications and a financial bid on the project.

**Tender Information**
----------------------

*   **Procurement Category:** Construction Services
*   **Procurement Method:** Competitive Open Bidding
*   **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   **Regions of Operation:** Canada
*   **Regions of Delivery:** Alberta
